intro: Virea autumnalis, commonly known as autumn virea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Virea autumnalis is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and as a companion plant in naturalistic landscapes.
